intro: Guarea rhopalocarpa, commonly known as the hook-leaf guarea, is a tropical tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and other valuable hardwoods. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are often elliptical or ovate in shape. Its flowers are small and clustered in axillary inflorescences, typically yellow or greenish in color. The fruit is a woody capsule that splits open to release its seeds.
